p: The pasting temperature of OFSP-based composite flours increased from 77.9 to 79.9 °C while the pasting time ranged between 3.7 and 3.8 min with an increase in substitution levels of skimmed milk and amaranth leaf powders. The pasting temperatures were significantly ( p < 0.05) higher than that of OFSP flour (74.3 °C). This provides an indication of minimum temperature required for cooking the porridge from the flours. The high pasting temperature of OFSP-based composite flours implies that more energy will be required for cooking porridge from OFSP-based composite flours than for flour from OFSP.
